thread.title: Eurozone faces crisis as IMF warns Greece’s debt is heading down ‘explosive’ path
thread.title_full: Eurozone faces crisis as IMF warns Greece’s debt is heading down ‘explosive’ path

author: ttowers
title: Eurozone faces crisis as IMF warns Greece’s debt is heading down ‘explosive’ path
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GREECE is in urgent need of a new bailout as its national debt heads down an “explosive path” that threatens the entire Eurozone, the International Monetary Fund has warned. 
The country is facing a new debt crisis in July when it is due to repay some 7billion euros despite years of austerity measures. Getty Images 3 The IMF called on Europe to provide ‘significant debt relief’ to Greece 
The IMF has called on Europe to provide “significant debt relief” to Greece – despite the country’s creditors ruling out any further rescue deals until 2018. 
Greek GDP grew by an estimated 0.4 per cent last year – but IMF economists expect growth in the coming years will be too low to repay its huge 86billion-euro bailout programme agreed in 2015. 
Athens cannot pay the money back without a fresh injection of bailout cash. Reuters Greek finance minister Euclid Tsakalotos said the IMF report ‘fails to do justice’ by underestimating growth RELATED STORIES LET'S GET GOING Theresa May defeats rebellion by senior pro-EU Tories on Brexit in the biggest challenge to her authority yet you berc John Bercow apologises for trying to ban Donald Trump from Parliament - Lords Speaker says he could still come tory housing revolution Sajid Javid vows to slash time taken by councils to start new developments in bid to fix housing crisis BACK ME OR BACK OFF Jeremy Corbyn warns Diane Abbott and Clive Lewis to back him on Brexit bill or risk losing jobs losing the plot Land will be seized from fat cats who fail to build on it in time as government cracks down on big builders FARAGE GIRLS' EMAIL FURY French politician living with Nigel Farage brands English women 'drunken tarts' and says French make better lovers in jibe at Ukip aide accused of being Brexiteer's 'other mistress' PA:Press Association EU opinion is divided on how to handle the problem Women in Greece march in protest against US President Donald Trump 
The grave situation has divided EU opinion over how to handle the problem. 
Germany is reluctant to send funds directly to Athens as populist parties in the country’s elections argue the cash will come from hard-working Germans. 
Greek finance minister Euclid Tsakalotos said the IMF report, released yesterday, “fails to do justice” by underestimating growth and progress made through years of austerity.
